subject: Technology
title: World of Warcraft and MMOs
description: A micro-lesson that makes World of Warcraft and MMOs usable.

hook.text: In 2004, millions of people started living second lives in a fantasy world called Azeroth.

buildup.text: World of Warcraft was a massively multiplayer online game where thousands played together in the same world.

discovery.text: Players formed guilds, built economies, and spent thousands of hours leveling up their characters.

twist.text: WoW addiction became a real concern. Some players lost jobs, relationships, and years to the game.

climax.text: At its peak, WoW had 12 million subscribers paying $15 per month. It defined a generation of gamers.

punchline.text: A virtual world became more compelling than real life for millions.

quiz.question: How many subscribers did World of Warcraft have at its peak?
